Definition: I believe human trafficking can be broadly defined as forcing a person or multiple people to engage in activities for the gain of the person coordinating the trafficking. These activities can be sexual activity, organ harvesting, forced labor, etc.
The abduction, sale and purchase, and enslavement of individuals. Often for a sexual purpose.
Thoughts: I learned some things that I did not know. Thank you for the information. Such an evil. We must keep fighting it!

Definition: kidnapping children and adults and selling them for sex, slavery
Perpetrators: Kidnappers / strangers, 1 percent, people of any kind of power, government, wealthy, greedy mean people. Drug dealers!

Definition: People being forced, coerced, or exploited into sex or labor, for the gain of someone else
Inhuman, forcing/grooming/coercing someone to do acts in which they do not consent to. Can take many forms such as forced labor, sex trafficking. Hard to detect at times.
The illegal movement of people, typically in association with slavery or prostitution.
Profiting off of human enslavement
Evil
a crime
The use of force, fraud or coercion to trap someone typically in sexual exploitation or forced labour ( I would include organ trafficking as well as child marriage in this as well).
Thoughts:
Great Job! Stats are so hard to navigate and often present an image that is inaccurate in depicting the true realities. For example, the stats on sexual exploitation vs labour. Factors such as initial exploitation vs forced participation once trapped. Shame and disbelief surrounding sexual exploitation for men and boys. So tricky. The stats regarding arab states being higher reported. Same thing.... Do they take into account population differences as well as govt agendas and resources. So many thoughts. 
You did an amazing job with this Hannah and to me it highlights the struggle to understand the breadth and width and scope of the problem as a whole.

Definition: When a person is made to give services (sexual, labour, etc) against their will. Basically, slave trading.
Ht
Human trafficking involves the use of force, fraud, or coercion to obtain some type of labor or commercial sex act.
The selling of a human being.
The forcible sale and movement of humans without their permission.
Human trafficking involves the use of force, fraud, or coercion to obtain some type of labor or commercial sex act.
Slavery and exploration, force , fraud or coercion
The exploitation of an individual through the use of force, fraud, and/or coercion.
The selling or trading of humans for labor, sex, or commercial purposes with or without their consent
Interest: I already work in an RTC for adolescent female survivors of trafficking

Definition: Any activity that forces or coerces a human being into servitude of any kind without their freely-given consent, especially for the purpose of financial gain for the perpetrator. In general, the entire network of organizations and individuals involved with the capture, confinement, and transportation of human beings for the above purposes.
Thoughts: As the adoptive father of a trafficked individual, I appreciate all of the efforts made by people worldwide to combat this evil network. Thank you!

Definition: It is the recruitment, harboring and obtaining a person for the purpose of sex trafficking or labor trafficking in which force, fraud or coercion is used to benefit from that survivor's work.

Initially, I would probably define it by its legal definition which speaks of the use of force, fraud, and coercion for sex acts. After walking with survivors for a few years now, I might broaden this definition to include its impact on the individual including things like trauma and complex PTSD, housing and financial instability, the high probability of re-victimization, and the very challenging road of rebuilding one's life after exiting.
Human trafficking is recruiting, harboring, transporting, providing, obtaining, patronizing, or soliciting of a person for labor or services.
Thoughts: Thank you for spreading awareness.  Blessings and prayers to you!

Definition: forced or feel no other choice but to engage in sexual or physical labor act in order to survive or for the benefit of someone else
slavery
Act/Means/Purpose (AMP) Model, exploitation, trauma, coercion, luring, grooming, control
HT is the illegal trade of human beings for labor or sex; using force, grooming, manipulation and exploitation.
Thoughts: Once the "victims" are recovered and in rehab, we need more housing opportunities and mandatory counseling services for them and their families(children). Their recovery is about PTSD- and we need to all work to answer their needs.

Definition: proof of force, fraud, or coercion unless they are under 18 years of age.
Thoughts: very interesting. I learned some things:)

Definition: Labor, sex, organs, benefits, received through force, fraud, or coercion.
commercial sex by a person under 18 or through any means of control or a person working and not being paid accordingly or treated well
Using force, fraud or coercion in order to benefit from someones work or service

The enslavement of and selling a person who is reduced to a "commodity" and forced against their will to perform actions where the "beneficiary" of those actions pays the enslaver who is in turn profiting financially from the exchange.
Perpetrators: Family, Foster system, Kidnappers / strangers, Governments
Interest: Already actively engaged in the fight

Definition: The illegal business of selling people as products for another's gain.
Human trafficking is the use of force, fraud, or coercion bring a person into commercial sex or labor.
Forced labor, including sexual, through coercion, intimidation, or force.
Trading humans for the purpose of forced sexual acts, commercial sexual exploitation, forced labor, or forced slavery
Interest: Currently engaged on the front lines in the anti-trafficking movement in the U.S.

Definition:
being prostituted by a family member, boyfriend, or pimp 

survival sex for food, shelter, or money

trading of sex for drugs or alcohol

legally defined as trafficking if under 18yo (CSEC)

being the subject of pornography

stripping; illicit massage parlors; escort services

child marriage; mail order bride

sexual exploitation through religion

sexual exploitation of refugee/immigrant

sexual exploitation as act of war

modern-day slavery. Coercion of a person against their will to work (labor), etc.... It looks very different from case to case. Sometimes the trafficker uses force and entrapment and other times it is a family member or close friend that has manipulated the victim by circumstances / guilt, etc...
exploitation for sex or labor through coercion
Thoughts: I often do not focus on stats, because the crime is truly hidden and some of it is considered "the life." For what is out of the norm for me is very much the common practice or expected social norm for a community or people group. That does not mean it is excusable, but much of the conversation about human trafficking does filter down into morals rather than the general understanding that objectification of humans is the very core of trafficking. That said, stats are helpful to educate and understand, but I always weigh lived experiences as more valuable than any generalized stat because there is no universal standard for what is commercial sex versus sexual exploitation, and that gets even murkier with labor trafficking.

Definition: Modern day sex slavery, sexual exploitation of women and girls for the gain of their traffickers.

I define Human Trafficking with the Criminal Code of Canada definition: It involves the recruitment, transportation and harboring of persons and/or control of their movements for the purpose of exploiting them, typically for sexual exploitation or forced labour. 

And with the UN Definition: 
Human Trafficking is the exploitation of human beings for gain. HT Involves as action, means, and purpose.
Thoughts: I am not sure what the data is being used for or how it is being used and represented. The information provided I haven't seen those statistics before. The way the survey was presented it forces the participants to guess, therefore I have concerns about misrepresentation on the data and responses. The data represented in this survey is not accurate of my knowledge or work in anti-human trafficking work.

Definition: insidious, force, fraud, coercion, under reported, overlooked, stigma of prostitution
Thoughts: HT can never be tackled without tackling the demand. Johns aka rapists need stronger punishments. Traffickers are mere opportunists. The Demand needs to be lessened.

Definition: One person exploiting the vulnerabilities of another person for financial or material gain through labor or sex
Coercing people to ones own benefit usually forced labor or sexual exploitation
The exploitation of a person for the purpose of compelled labor or commercial sex act.
forced, coerced, manipulated, tricked, trading something for sex like food, shelter, drugs, etc.
Perpetrators: family, trusted friend, or someone who gains their trust

Definition: Exploiting another person for your own gain through the use of force, fraud, or coercion
The exploitation of a person or persons through force for fraud or coercion
The use of force, fraud, or coercion to require the exchange of sex for something of value. Or, simply the exchange of sex for something of value in which one participant is under the age of 18.
Selling young girls
Labor or sex trafficking. Where you cannot flee and are forced to do things for money that you do not want to.
compelling or coercing someone to provide labour or services or engage in commercial sex acts. The coercion can be subtle, overt, psychological or physical.
Perpetrators: someone who builds trust/a relationship with the victim

Definition: Force, fraud, or coercion to engage in commercial sex acts or labor
Being used against your free will for the benefit/gain of others
Human trafficking is the trade of humans for the purpose of forced labour, sexual slavery, or commercial sexual exploitatio
Offense
It is an illegal and highly immoral act. It is an abuse of human rights.
People are traded as objects and forced to do things they don't want to do.
when people are exploited by others to work in the drug, sex, or other illegal trade.
